tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE security_patches (
    patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    patch_name TEXT,
    patch_date DATE,
    patch_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE security_patches (
    patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    patch_version VARCHAR(20),
    release_date TIMESTAMP,
    description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50),
    manufacturer VARCHAR(50),
    firmware_version VARCHAR(20),
    last_update TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE SecurityPatches (
    patch_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT NOT NULL,
    patch_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    patch_description TEXT,
    patch_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Devices (
    device_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    device_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    device_location VARCHAR(50),
    device_status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE PatchLogs (
    log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    patch_id INT NOT NULL,
    device_id INT NOT NULL,
    log_date TIMESTAMP,
    log_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE security_patches (
    patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    patch_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    patch_description TEXT,
    patch_url VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    release_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE patch_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    patch_id INT,
    log_description TEXT,
    log_date TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES smart_home_devices(device_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (patch_id) REFERENCES security_patches(patch_id)
);

CREATE TABLE security_patches (
  patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  device_id INT,
  patch_name VARCHAR(50),
  patch_description TEXT,
  patch_version DECIMAL(5,2),
  patch_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE devices (
  device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  device_name VARCHAR(50),
  device_type VARCHAR(50),
  install_date DATE,
  last_update DATE
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerabilities (
  vulnerability_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  device_id INT,
  vulnerability_name VARCHAR(50),
  vulnerability_description TEXT,
  vulnerability_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE patch_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  patch_id INT,
  device_id INT,
  log_description TEXT,
  log_date TIMESTAMP
);
